trans-unit.source: Converts text data to integer encoded features using the Vowpal Wabbit library
trans-unit.target: Converts text data to integer encoded features using the Vowpal Wabbit library

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Feature Hashing</ui> module to transform a stream of English text into a set of features represented as integers.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Feature Hashing</ui> module to transform a stream of English text into a set of features represented as integers.

trans-unit.source: For example, suppose you have a set of sentences like this one:
trans-unit.target: For example, suppose you have a set of sentences like this one:

trans-unit.source: Internally, the <ui>Feature Hashing</ui> module creates a dictionary of n-grams, converts the dictionary terms into hash values, and then computes their use in each case.
trans-unit.target: Internally, the <ui>Feature Hashing</ui> module creates a dictionary of n-grams, converts the dictionary terms into hash values, and then computes their use in each case.

trans-unit.source: Each hashing feature represents one or more n-gram text features.
trans-unit.target: Each hashing feature represents one or more n-gram text features.

trans-unit.source: You can control the size of the n-grams by using the <ui>N-grams</ui> property.
trans-unit.target: You can control the size of the n-grams by using the <ui>N-grams</ui> property.

trans-unit.source: If <ui>N-grams</ui> = 2: Bigrams, or two words in succession.
trans-unit.target: If <ui>N-grams</ui> = 2: Bigrams, or two words in succession.

trans-unit.source: If <ui>N-grams</ui> = 3: Trigrams, or three words in a row.
trans-unit.target: If <ui>N-grams</ui> = 3: Trigrams, or three words in a row.

trans-unit.source: After hashing, the features for each case would look something like this:
trans-unit.target: After hashing, the features for each case would look something like this:

trans-unit.source: In contrast, if you pass the column of text data directly to the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module, it would handle the text column as a categorical feature column, with many, many distinct values.
trans-unit.target: In contrast, if you pass the column of text data directly to the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module, it would handle the text column as a categorical feature column, with many, many distinct values.

trans-unit.source: The advantage of using feature hashing, compared to working with text directly, is that you can represent text documents of variable-length as numeric feature vectors of equal-length, and achieve dimensionality reduction.
trans-unit.target: The advantage of using feature hashing, compared to working with text directly, is that you can represent text documents of variable-length as numeric feature vectors of equal-length, and achieve dimensionality reduction.

trans-unit.source: Having the outputs as numeric also makes it possible to use many different machine learning methods with the data, including classification, clustering, or information retrieval.
trans-unit.target: Having the outputs as numeric also makes it possible to use many different machine learning methods with the data, including classification, clustering, or information retrieval.

trans-unit.source: Because it replaces string comparison operations with hash lookups, <ui>Feature Hashing</ui> makes the lookup of feature weights much faster.
trans-unit.target: Because it replaces string comparison operations with hash lookups, <ui>Feature Hashing</ui> makes the lookup of feature weights much faster.

trans-unit.source: Some best practices that you can use while modeling text data are demonstrated in the following diagram representing an experiment:
trans-unit.target: Some best practices that you can use while modeling text data are demonstrated in the following diagram representing an experiment:

trans-unit.source: You might need to add an <link xlink:href="30806023-392b-42e0-94d6-6b775a6e0fd5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Execute R Script</link> module before using <ui>Feature Hashing</ui>, in order to preprocess the input text.
trans-unit.target: You might need to add an <link xlink:href="30806023-392b-42e0-94d6-6b775a6e0fd5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Execute R Script</link> module before using <ui>Feature Hashing</ui>, in order to preprocess the input text.

trans-unit.source: Processing includes word breaking, stop word removal, case normalization, removing special characters, and stemming.
trans-unit.target: Processing includes word breaking, stop word removal, case normalization, removing special characters, and stemming.

trans-unit.source: You should add a <link xlink:href="1ec722fa-b623-4e26-a44e-a50c6d726223" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Project Columns</link> module after the <ui>Feature Hashing</ui> to remove the text columns from the output data set.
trans-unit.target: You should add a <link xlink:href="1ec722fa-b623-4e26-a44e-a50c6d726223" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Project Columns</link> module after the <ui>Feature Hashing</ui> to remove the text columns from the output data set.

trans-unit.source: You don’t need the text columns after the hashing features have been generated.
trans-unit.target: You don’t need the text columns after the hashing features have been generated.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Studio provides a <externalLink><linkText>template for text classification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525957</linkUri></externalLink> that lets you to use the feature hashing module for feature extraction.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Studio provides a <externalLink><linkText>template for text classification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525957</linkUri></externalLink> that lets you to use the feature hashing module for feature extraction.

trans-unit.source: For examples of how feature hashing is used in for text analytics, see these samples in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how feature hashing is used in for text analytics, see these samples in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>News Categorization sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525167</linkUri></externalLink> uses feature hashing to classify articles into a predefined list of categories.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>News Categorization sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525167</linkUri></externalLink> uses feature hashing to classify articles into a predefined list of categories.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Similar Companies sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525164</linkUri></externalLink> uses the text of Wikipedia articles to categorize companies.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Similar Companies sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525164</linkUri></externalLink> uses the text of Wikipedia articles to categorize companies.

trans-unit.source: In the five-part <externalLink><linkText>Text Classification sample</linkText><linkUri>Text Classification sample</linkUri></externalLink>, text from Twitter messages is used to perform sentiment analysis.
trans-unit.target: In the five-part <externalLink><linkText>Text Classification sample</linkText><linkUri>Text Classification sample</linkUri></externalLink>, text from Twitter messages is used to perform sentiment analysis.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Feature Hashing</ui> module uses a fast machine learning framework called Vowpal Wabbit that hashes feature words into in-memory indexes, using a popular open source hash function called murmurhash3.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Feature Hashing</ui> module uses a fast machine learning framework called Vowpal Wabbit that hashes feature words into in-memory indexes, using a popular open source hash function called murmurhash3.

trans-unit.source: This hash function is a non-cryptographic hashing algorithm that maps text inputs to integers, and is popular because it performs well in a random distribution of keys.
trans-unit.target: This hash function is a non-cryptographic hashing algorithm that maps text inputs to integers, and is popular because it performs well in a random distribution of keys.

trans-unit.source: Unlike cryptographic hash functions, it can be easily reversed by an adversary, so that it is unsuitable for cryptographic purposes
trans-unit.target: Unlike cryptographic hash functions, it can be easily reversed by an adversary, so that it is unsuitable for cryptographic purposes

trans-unit.source: The purpose of hashing is to convert variable-length text documents into equal-length numeric feature vectors, to support dimensionality reduction and make the lookup of feature weights faster.
trans-unit.target: The purpose of hashing is to convert variable-length text documents into equal-length numeric feature vectors, to support dimensionality reduction and make the lookup of feature weights faster.

trans-unit.source: Each hashing feature represents one or more n-gram text features (unigrams or individual words, bi-grams, tri-grams, etc.), depending on the number of bits (represented as <math>k</math>) and on the number of n-grams specified as parameters.
trans-unit.target: Each hashing feature represents one or more n-gram text features (unigrams or individual words, bi-grams, tri-grams, etc.), depending on the number of bits (represented as <math>k</math>) and on the number of n-grams specified as parameters.

trans-unit.source: It projects feature names to the machine architecture unsigned word using the murmurhash v3 (32-bit only) algorithm which then is ANDed with <math>(2^k)-1</math>.
trans-unit.target: It projects feature names to the machine architecture unsigned word using the murmurhash v3 (32-bit only) algorithm which then is ANDed with <math>(2^k)-1</math>.

trans-unit.source: That is, the hashed value is projected down to the first <math>k</math> lower-order bits, and the remaining bits are zeroed out.
trans-unit.target: That is, the hashed value is projected down to the first <math>k</math> lower-order bits, and the remaining bits are zeroed out.

trans-unit.source: If the specified number of bits is 14, the hash table can hold <math>2</math><superscript>14</superscript><math>-1</math> (or 16,383) entries.
trans-unit.target: If the specified number of bits is 14, the hash table can hold <math>2</math><superscript>14</superscript><math>-1</math> (or 16,383) entries.

trans-unit.source: For many problems, the default hash table (bitsize = 10) is more than adequate, but in some cases, more space might be needed to avoid collisions.
trans-unit.target: For many problems, the default hash table (bitsize = 10) is more than adequate, but in some cases, more space might be needed to avoid collisions.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you try using a different number of bits for the <ui>Hashing bitsize</ui> parameter, and evaluate the performance of the machine learning solution.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you try using a different number of bits for the <ui>Hashing bitsize</ui> parameter, and evaluate the performance of the machine learning solution.

trans-unit.source: Choose the columns to which hashing will be applied
trans-unit.target: Choose the columns to which hashing will be applied

trans-unit.source: Type the number of bits to use when hashing the selected columns
trans-unit.target: Type the number of bits to use when hashing the selected columns

trans-unit.source: Specify the number of N-grams generated during hashing
trans-unit.target: Specify the number of N-grams generated during hashing

trans-unit.source: By default, both unigrams and bigrams are extracted
trans-unit.target: By default, both unigrams and bigrams are extracted

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if one or more specified columns of data set couldn't be found.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if one or more specified columns of data set couldn't be found.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if parameter is less than or equal to specific value.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if parameter is less than or equal to specific value.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if one or more specified columns have type unsupported by current module.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if one or more specified columns have type unsupported by current module.
